qa_pairs.question: You got some apple juice there, Joe?
qa_pairs.answer: We have some somewhere.

qa_pairs.question: You play the law of averages there, right?
qa_pairs.answer: It just depends on the size of the network, right? Every once in a while there's someone with a BitAxe that throws out a Bitcoin block. That's pretty cool to see.

qa_pairs.question: You have enough panels to run your whole house, Joe?
qa_pairs.answer: It's not a ton of power, but yeah.

qa_pairs.question: Initially, Autolykos was used for to resist mining pools, right? Initially with Ergo, was that the deal? You didn't want mining pools.
qa_pairs.answer: Well, mining pools are pretty toxic in terms of the security assumptions, right? Bitcoin, it's like three entities that control block production and like that's terrible. But nonetheless, you have all of these individual miners that do have like local custody of their hardware.

qa_pairs.question: So now, but with Lithos, right? The individual miners are going to have to be more in tune to that and pay more attention to stocking blocks and stacking them full of transactions.
qa_pairs.answer: Yeah, I think there's some really interesting potential like in terms of building markets, right? Because that's ultimately what you want, is to build free markets on top of these systems.

qa_pairs.question: You think we'll see other chains adopt Demurage after the fact, Joe?
qa_pairs.answer: It's really dirty, too, in my opinion. Pretty rough assumptions to throw on a chain. I'll get on like Twitter or X or whatever the fuck people are called these days, and I'll talk about Demurage, because I do think that it's a really clean solution in terms of like UTXO state management, right?

qa_pairs.question: Luca, can you hear us?
qa_pairs.answer: Yeah, we're good.

qa_pairs.question: The amazing Luca, how are you doing?
qa_pairs.answer: I'm good. I'm okay.

qa_pairs.question: Were you doing any judging on that hackathon that they did?
qa_pairs.answer: I wasn't in I was in India for two days. It's a long story.

qa_pairs.question: Yeah, we got lots of time. Luca, tell us what are you doing in India?
qa_pairs.answer: Well, I was, I was going to go to, I was supposed to be in India for like two weeks to go to this hackathon, like to not participate, but like help out and then be in the workshop in person. But I kind of had a bad jet lag and culture shock.

qa_pairs.question: Luca, you're from Canada, aren't you?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes.

qa_pairs.question: No, Luca, was it a lot? Did you lose a lot?
qa_pairs.answer: Well, I might get a 50% refund.

qa_pairs.question: I'm sorry, dude. That's rough. Would you ever try it again? Would you ever go to India again?
qa_pairs.answer: Yeah, for sure. It's actually not so bad. Well, New Delhi is really bad pollution. When I came back, my shorts still stank of the pollution. That's how bad it was.

qa_pairs.question: In 2026, what do you do? Should we do the Ergo meetup in Colorado or should we go out to New York?
qa_pairs.answer: It's cool. I guess you like, I mean, it's cool if it's in different places closer to you, isn't it? Yeah. You could drive here six hours, I think. Right.

qa_pairs.question: Yeah, what are you working on, buddy?
qa_pairs.answer: I'm trying to launch Gluon Dollar.

qa_pairs.question: So what the so this is, this is a concept that Bruno came up with, and then you, you conceptualize with mathematics, or he conceptualized the mathematics and you implemented the code?
qa_pairs.answer: So, so what was actually cool is like, he's been thinking about stablecoins for a long time. So it's based on a, so Jed, even if you go all the way back, it's like started off from a paper on it from Ethereum called Staticoin. And I remember reading it and it was confusing because I got used to the notation that Bruno came up with for Jed and Gluon. It's much more intuitive.

qa_pairs.question: Jed's on Cardano right only Cardano right now.
qa_pairs.answer: No, I meant Jed as in the paper.

qa_pairs.question: Oh, the paper Jed. OK, who implemented Jed on Cardano? Is that somebody? Cody.
qa_pairs.answer: Yeah, they did a weird job. Yeah, yeah, yeah.

qa_pairs.question: Where's the ADA growing from in this circumstance, in this scenario?
qa_pairs.answer: Just protocol inflation.

qa_pairs.question: Look, are you on my time zone? Luca? Are you on Eastern time zone?
qa_pairs.answer: Yeah.

qa_pairs.question: What are you doing up so late? Luca? Do you sleep?
qa_pairs.answer: Sometimes, sometimes I was watching all in.

qa_pairs.question: If Ergo is successful in three years from now, what will people be using it for on a daily basis?
qa_pairs.answer: Well, right now, if you look at what separates Ergo from most other cryptocurrencies is these derivatives that we've created, right? So there's been a lot of work that's been put into censorship resistant DeFi versus just creating the censorship enabled DeFi, which is not really then DeFi because you have an underlying party that can essentially reverse or freeze or seize everybody's assets.

qa_pairs.question: So you say you say, sorry, go for it. Look, what do you say to this to Ergo three years? What are you using it for? What's it going to be used for?
qa_pairs.answer: Well, like I would like to use crypto. I would like to get to a point where like cryptocurrencies normalized in general and like society in general, like you just pay for things on a regular basis. That would be really cool. I don't know that it's going to happen in three years necessarily.

qa_pairs.question: How old are you, Luca? Are you 27?
Do you remember the Cyprus bank crisis that they went through?
qa_pairs.answer: I was not aware of that.
